comments.body: We don't provide `psycopg2-binary` on conda-forge.  It appears to just be an unoptimized, simplified version of `psycopg2`.  This patch is to make `pip check` happy.

`psycopg2-binary` should be the same as `psycopg2`, the only difference is that the former provides wheels and the other one doesn't and I would expected that it provides the same metadata. If there is a difference in Python package metadata between both, we should add that to `psycopg2` package.
Yes, without this change, `pip check` fails so it sounds like maybe `psycopg2-binary` should be created in some format that `pip check` will recognize (i.e. not just a `conda` metapackage).

my dream is something that _doesn't_ require pip to do what `pip check` does... raise your hand if you've missed a `setuptools` dependency because of `pkg_utils` :hand: 

for now, because `conda`, i think this is a way to proceed, and is _unlikely_ to break anything, so long as the patch breaks when/if this number changes.
We don't provide `psycopg2-binary` on conda-forge.  It appears to just be an unoptimized, simplified version of `psycopg2`.  This patch is to make `pip check` happy.

`psycopg2-binary` should be the same as `psycopg2`, the only difference is that the former provides wheels and the other one doesn't and I would expected that it provides the same metadata. If there is a difference in Python package metadata between both, we should add that to `psycopg2` package.
Yes, without this change, `pip check` fails so it sounds like maybe `psycopg2-binary` should be created in some format that `pip check` will recognize (i.e. not just a `conda` metapackage).

my dream is something that _doesn't_ require pip to do what `pip check` does... raise your hand if you've missed a `setuptools` dependency because of `pkg_utils` :hand: 

for now, because `conda`, i think this is a way to proceed, and is _unlikely_ to break anything, so long as the patch breaks when/if this number changes.
